intro: Hymenostephium viride, commonly known as the green hymenostephium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its attractive appearance, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in botanical gardens.
